str2: As if, as it were, like; with numbers: about. From hos and ei; as if.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go up, mount, ascend; of things: I rise, spring up, come up. From ana and the base of basis; to go up.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
To pray, pray for, offer prayer. From pros and euchomai; to pray to God, i.e. Supplicate, worship.
